title: Sludge Elf
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| - | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | This is a somewhat degenerate species of Elves. They are mirror images of High Elves in some respects: they have no special proficiency with bows or swords (long or short), nor do they have any aptitude in the traditional areas of High Elven magic (charms and conjurations). On the other hand, they are superlative transmuters, and are comfortable dabbling in necromantic, poison and elemental magic. As fighters, they are often more dangerous unarmed than armed. They advance in levels slightly slower than Humans, but faster than all other Elves. |

## Contents

- [1 Innate Abilities](#Innate_Abilities)
- [2 Preferred Backgrounds](#Preferred_Backgrounds)
- [3 Level Bonuses](#Level_Bonuses)
- [4 Starting Equipment and Skills](#Starting_Equipment_and_Skills)
- [5 Difficulty of Play](#Difficulty_of_Play)
- [6 Skill aptitudes](#Skill_aptitudes)
- [7 History](#History)

## Innate Abilities

- Sludge Elves get a small bonus when using [elven](/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment") weapons and armour. For Sludge Elves, elven armour impeded spellcasting less than other armours and improved their effective [Armour skill](/Armour_skill "Armour skill"). They were slightly more accurate with elven weapons.

## Preferred Backgrounds

- **Warriors:** [Monk](/Monk "Monk"), [Hunter](/Hunter "Hunter"), [Assassin](/Assassin "Assassin")
- **Zealots:** [Healer](/Healer "Healer")
- **Warrior-mages:** [Transmuter](/Transmuter "Transmuter")
- **Mages:** [Wizard](/Wizard "Wizard"), [Summoner](/Summoner "Summoner"), [Necromancer](/Necromancer "Necromancer"), [Fire Elementalist](/Fire_Elementalist "Fire Elementalist"), [Ice Elementalist](/Ice_Elementalist "Ice Elementalist"), [Air Elementalist](/Air_Elementalist "Air Elementalist"), [Earth Elementalist](/Earth_Elementalist "Earth Elementalist"), [Venom Mage](/Venom_Mage "Venom Mage")

## Level Bonuses

- +1 [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") or [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") (equal chance) every 4th level.
- 10% less [HP](/HP "HP") than average.
- 10% more [MP](/MP "MP") than average.
- +4 [magic resistance](/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") per level.

## Starting Equipment and Skills

Sludge Elves start with the equipment and skills listed for their background, with the following exceptions:

- All equipment is "[elven](/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment")" in quality, where such variants exist.

## Difficulty of Play

Sludge Elves are a moderately difficult species to play: they have -10% HP, and their aptitudes favor a few, complicated, styles of play. They are great at Unarmed Combat and Transmutations... but without the HP, strength, or Claws of a [Troll](/Troll "Troll"), Unarmed is harder to 'get off the ground'.

## Skill aptitudes

Values are from the most recent version that had both the species and the skill:

|                [Skill](/Skill "Skill")               | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |             [Skill](/Skill "Skill")             | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") | [Skill](/Skill "Skill")                            | [Aptitude](/Aptitude "Aptitude") |
| :--------------------------------------------------: | :------------------------------: | :---------------------------------------------: | -------------------------------: | -------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------: |
|                     ***Attack***                     |                                  |               ***Miscellaneous***               |                                  | ***Magic***                                        |                                  |
|           [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting")           |                 1                |            [Armour](/Armour "Armour")           |                               -2 | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")       |                                1 |
|     [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades")     |                -1                |          [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging")          |                                2 | [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations")       |                               -2 |
|       [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")      |                -1                | [Stealth](/Stealth_\(skill\) "Stealth (skill)") |                                2 | [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes")                            |                                0 |
| [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") |                -2                | [Shields](/Shields_\(skill\) "Shields (skill)") |                               -2 | [Charms](/Charms "Charms")                         |                               -2 |
|                 [Axes](/Axes "Axes")                 |                -2                |         [Stabbing](/Stabbing "Stabbing")        |                                0 | [Summonings](/Summonings "Summonings")             |                                1 |
|           [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")           |                -2                |             [Traps](/Traps "Traps")             |                                0 | [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy")             |                                1 |
|       [Staves](/Magical_staff "Magical staff")       |                 0                |                                                 |                                  | [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations") |                                0 |
|  [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat")  |                 1                |    [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations")    |                                1 | [Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations") |                                3 |
|                                                      |                                  |      [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations")     |                                1 |                                                    |                                  |
|           [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")           |                 2                | [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting") |                              N/A | [Fire Magic](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic")             |                                1 |
|  [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")  |                N/A               |                                                 |                                  | [Ice Magic](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic")                |                                1 |
|              [Slings](/Slings "Slings")              |                 0                |      [Experience](/Experience "Experience")     |                                0 | [Air Magic](/Air_Magic "Air Magic")                |                                1 |
|                 [Bows](/Bows "Bows")                 |                 0                |                                                 |                                  | [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic")          |                                1 |
|          [Crossbows](/Crossbows "Crossbows")         |                 0                |                                                 |                                  | [Poison Magic](/Poison_Magic "Poison Magic")       |                                1 |
|                                                      |                                  |                                                 |                                  | [Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy")                      |                              N/A |

## History

- Sludge Elves were removed in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13").
html:
Sludge Elf

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
This is a somewhat degenerate species of Elves. They are mirror images of High Elves in some respects: they have no special proficiency with bows or swords (long or short), nor do they have any aptitude in the traditional areas of High Elven magic (charms and conjurations). On the other hand, they are superlative transmuters, and are comfortable dabbling in necromantic, poison and elemental magic. As fighters, they are often more dangerous unarmed than armed. They advance in levels slightly slower than Humans, but faster than all other Elves.

Contents

  • 1 Innate Abilities
  • 2 Preferred Backgrounds
  • 3 Level Bonuses
  • 4 Starting Equipment and Skills
  • 5 Difficulty of Play
  • 6 Skill aptitudes
  • 7 History

Innate Abilities

  • Sludge Elves get a small bonus when using elven weapons and armour. For Sludge Elves, elven armour impeded spellcasting less than other armours and improved their effective Armour skill. They were slightly more accurate with elven weapons.

Preferred Backgrounds

  • Warriors: Monk, Hunter, Assassin
  • Zealots: Healer
  • Warrior-mages: Transmuter
  • Mages: Wizard, Summoner, Necromancer, Fire Elementalist, Ice Elementalist, Air Elementalist, Earth Elementalist, Venom Mage

Level Bonuses

  • +1 intelligence or dexterity (equal chance) every 4th level.
  • 10% less HP than average.
  • 10% more MP than average.
  • +4 magic resistance per level.

Starting Equipment and Skills

Sludge Elves start with the equipment and skills listed for their background, with the following exceptions:

  • All equipment is "elven" in quality, where such variants exist.

Difficulty of Play

Sludge Elves are a moderately difficult species to play: they have -10% HP, and their aptitudes favor a few, complicated, styles of play. They are great at Unarmed Combat and Transmutations... but without the HP, strength, or Claws of a Troll, Unarmed is harder to 'get off the ground'.

Skill aptitudes

Values are from the most recent version that had both the species and the skill:

Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude Skill Aptitude
Attack Miscellaneous Magic
Fighting 1 Armour -2 Spellcasting 1
Short Blades -1 Dodging 2 Conjurations -2
Long Blades -1 Stealth 2 Hexes 0
Maces & Flails -2 Shields -2 Charms -2
Axes -2 Stabbing 0 Summonings 1
Polearms -2 Traps 0 Necromancy 1
Staves 0 Translocations 0
Unarmed Combat 1 Invocations 1 Transmutations 3
Evocations 1
Throwing 2 Shapeshifting N/A Fire Magic 1
Ranged Weapons N/A Ice Magic 1
Slings 0 Experience 0 Air Magic 1
Bows 0 Earth Magic 1
Crossbows 0 Poison Magic 1
Alchemy N/A

History

  • Sludge Elves were removed in 0.13.

==Starting Equipment and Skills==
Sludge Elves start with the equipment and skills listed for their background, with the following exceptions:
*All equipment is "[[racial equipment|elven]]" in quality, where such variants exist.

==Difficulty of Play==
Sludge Elves are a moderately difficult species to play: they have -10% HP, and their aptitudes favor a few, complicated, styles of play. They are great at Unarmed Combat and Transmutations... but without the HP, strength, or Claws of a [[Troll]], Unarmed is harder to 'get off the ground'.
